intro: Epipactis phyllanthes var. olarionensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and a single, showy greenish-yellow flower with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks. It is a perennial species that produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in late spring to early summer. The orchid is pollinated primarily by bees and is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
